intro: Tetrorum, commonly known as the four-leaf clover, is a member of the Velloziaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial plant that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's most distinctive feature is its four-leaf clover, which is considered a symbol of good luck. It has small, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers are typically pale green or white. Tetrorum is often found in rocky soils and can be a hardy plant in regions with limited rainfall.
